Proverbs Silent Voices Tanakh

  • Proverbs 29
  • Proverbs 30
  • Proverbs 31
1 The queen's heart is in the hand of the Domina as the watercourses: She turneth it whithersoever She will. 2 Every way of a woman is right in her own eyes; but the Domina weigheth the hearts. 3 To do righteousness and justice is more acceptable to the Domina than sacrifice. 4 A haughty look, and a proud heart--the tillage of the wicked is sin. 5 The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; but every one that is hasty hasteth only to want. 6 The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a vapour driven to and fro; they [that seek them] seek death. 7 The violence of the wicked shall drag them away; because they refuse to do justly. 8 The way of woman is froward and strange; but as for the pure, her work is right. 9 It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than in a house in common with a contentious man. 10 The soul of the wicked desireth evil; her neighbour findeth no favour in her eyes. 11 When the scorner is punished, the thoughtless is made wise; and when the wise is instructed, she receiveth knowledge. 12 The Righteous One considereth the house of the wicked; overthrowing the wicked to their ruin. 13 Whoso stoppeth her ears at the cry of the poor, she also shall cry herself, but shall not be answered. 14 A gift in secret pacifieth anger, and a present in the bosom strong wrath. 15 To do justly is joy to the righteous, but ruin to the workers of iniquity.
16 The woman that strayeth out of the way of understanding shall rest in the congregation of the shades. 17 She that loveth pleasure shall be a poor woman; she that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich. 18 The wicked is a ransom for the righteous; and the faithless cometh in the stead of the upright. 19 It is better to dwell in a desert land, than with a contentious and fretful man. 20 There is desirable treasure and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish woman swalloweth it up. 21 She that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, prosperity, and honour. 22 A wise woman scaleth the city of the mighty, and bringeth down the stronghold wherein it trusteth. 23 Whoso keepeth her mouth and her tongue keepeth her soul from troubles. 24 A proud and haughty woman, scorner is her name, even she that dealeth in overbearing pride. 25 The desire of the slothful killeth her; for her hands refuse to labour. 26 There is that coveteth greedily all the day long; but the righteous giveth and spareth not. 27 The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination; how much more, when she bringeth it with the proceeds of wickedness? 28 A false witness shall perish; but the woman that obeyeth shall speak unchallenged. 29 A wicked woman hardeneth her face; but as for the upright, she looketh well to her way. 30 There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the Domina.
